intro: Cephaloschoenus tenuirostris, commonly known as the slender-beaked water plant, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
